abstract_summ: Conclusion: These group testing schemes could lead to a major reduction in the number of testing kits required and help improve large-scale population testing in general and in the context of the current COVID-19 pandemic.CONCLUSION: These group testing schemes could lead to a major reduction in the number of testing kits required and help improve large-scale population testing in general and in the context of the current COVID-19 pandemic.We designed and built an evaluation model that simulates test subject population, infected test subjects according to available Covid-19 statistics, and the group testing processes in SCALE19.Objectives: Herein, we developed and evaluated multi-stage group testing schemes that test samples in groups of various pool sizes in multiple stages.OBJECTIVE: Herein, we developed and evaluated multi-stage group testing schemes that test samples in groups of various pool sizes in multiple stages.
title_summ: Analysis and Applications of Adaptive Group Testing Methods for COVID-19A strategy for finding people infected with SARS-CoV-2: optimizing pooled testing at low prevalenceSCALE19: A scalable and cost-efficient method for testing Covid-19 based on hierarchical group testingMulti-Stage Group Testing Improves Efficiency of Large-Scale COVID-19 ScreeningA strategy for finding people infected with SARS-CoV-2: optimizing pooled testing at low prevalenceCOVID-19: Strategies for Allocation of Test KitsGroup Testing-Based Robust Algorithm for Diagnosis of COVID-19Multi-Stage Group Testing Improves Efficiency of Large-Scale COVID-19 Screening
title_abstract_phrases: Conclusion: These group testing schemes could lead to a major reduction in the number of testing kits required and help improve large-scale population testing in general and in the context of the current COVID-19 pandemic.CONCLUSION: These group testing schemes could lead to a major reduction in the number of testing kits required and help improve large-scale population testing in general and in the context of the current COVID-19 pandemic.We designed and built an evaluation model that simulates test subject population, infected test subjects according to available Covid-19 statistics, and the group testing processes in SCALE19.In this paper we propose non-adaptive and adaptive group testing strategies based on generalized binary splitting (GBS) [2] where we restrict the group test to the largest group that can be used.RT-PCR (reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction) tests are accurate but costly, making regular testing of every individual expensive.
